column4: ive got a problem with flash playing stuttery sometimes, ubuntu 10.10 on a new laptop, got ubuntu-restricted-extras installed. what could it be, how to get it to flow better?
How did you install flash
are you talking about FlashPlayer Plugin ?
nope, so it could be a firefox problem?
shouldnt flasplayer be in ubuntu restricted extras
I don't think so.
well flash does play. what should i install then?
then what is your problem ?
its stuttering, even though its buffered
Ok then I am asking, how and where did you install the flash player
well, at installation I chose to install 3d party software for media compatibility, and after install I installed ubuntu restricted extras. I never specifically/manually installd a flash player
That may be a graphic card related problem ? I'm not too sure about it .
I did enable the nvidia proprietary drives
maybe I should try and disable that, and see what happens
you will lose your resolution and many configs this is not recommended.

but I couldnt see any drawbacks before I installed/activated the proprietary nvidia drivers, I dont understand how it can suddenly cause problems afterwards. but okay, what other possible solutions are there?
Reinstall manually the flash player.
I have no idea what flashplayer ubuntu uses per default..
Go see the flash player that is currently installed into you package manager.
nofrillz: yes, I installed (and reinstalled) the restricted extras package, still flash is stuttering. got nvidia proprietary drives enabled
have you tried Chromium ?
